title: Find Longest Substring Without Repeating Characters
content:
Given a string, find the length of the longest substring without repeating characters.

Example: "abcabcbb"  3 ("abc")
explanation: Use sliding window technique with a hash map. Expand window by moving right pointer, track characters in current window. When duplicate found, move left pointer past the duplicate. Track maximum window size.

options.text: Use sliding window with hash map. Expand window, shrink when duplicate found. Time: O(n), Space: O(min(n, m)) where m is charset size
Check all possible substrings. Time: O(n), Space: O(n)
Use Set and check each substring. Time: O(n), Space: O(n)
Sort characters and find longest sequence. Time: O(n log n), Space: O(n)

title: Group Strings by Anagram
content:
Given an array of strings, group anagrams together.

Example: ["eat", "tea", "tan", "ate", "nat", "bat"]  [["eat","tea","ate"], ["tan","nat"], ["bat"]]
explanation: Two approaches: 1) Sort each string and use sorted string as key in hash map. 2) Use character frequency count as key (more efficient). Group strings with same key together.

options.text: Use sorted string as key in hash map. Group strings with same sorted key. Time: O(n*k log k) where k is avg string length, Space: O(n*k)
Compare each string with all others. Time: O(n*k), Space: O(n)
Use character frequency as key. Time: O(n*k), Space: O(n*k)
Sort entire array and group adjacent anagrams. Time: O(n*k log(n*k)), Space: O(n*k)

title: Find Container With Most Water
content:
Given an array of heights, find two lines that together with x-axis form a container that holds the most water.

Example: [1, 8, 6, 2, 5, 4, 8, 3, 7]  49
explanation: Use two pointers technique: start with pointers at both ends. Calculate area (min(height[left], height[right]) * (right - left)). Move the pointer with smaller height inward, as moving the larger one cannot increase area.

options.text: Use two pointers at start and end. Move pointer with smaller height. Calculate area and track max. Time: O(n), Space: O(1)
Try all pairs of lines. Time: O(n), Space: O(1)
Find two tallest lines. Time: O(n), Space: O(1)
Sort heights and use top two. Time: O(n log n), Space: O(n)

title: Find Longest Palindromic Substring
content:
Given a string, find the longest palindromic substring.

Example: "babad"  "bab" or "aba"
explanation: Expand around center: for each possible center (considering both odd and even length palindromes), expand outward while characters match. Track the longest palindrome found. More space-efficient than DP.

options.text: Expand around center for each possible center (odd and even length). Track longest. Time: O(n), Space: O(1)
Check all possible substrings. Time: O(n), Space: O(1)
Use dynamic programming. Time: O(n), Space: O(n)
Reverse string and find longest common substring. Time: O(n), Space: O(n)
